text: According to Proverbs 1:7, what is the beginning of knowledge?
verseText: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge; fools despise wisdom and instruction.

text: Proverbs 3:5 advises trusting in the LORD with what?
verseText: Trust in the LORD with all your heart, and do not lean on your own understanding.

text: What does Proverbs 6:6 tell the sluggard to consider?
verseText: Go to the ant, O sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise.

text: Proverbs 10:4 contrasts a slack hand with a diligent hand. What does the hand of the diligent do?
verseText: A slack hand causes poverty, but the hand of the diligent makes rich.

text: According to Proverbs 15:1, what turns away wrath?
verseText: A soft answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.

text: Proverbs 16:9 states that 'The heart of man plans his way, but...'?
verseText: The heart of man plans his way, but the LORD establishes his steps.

text: What does Proverbs 17:17 say a friend does?
verseText: A friend loves at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.

text: Proverbs 18:24 contrasts having many companions with what kind of friend?
options: A friend who sticks closer than a brother
verseText: A man of many companions may come to ruin, but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.

text: According to Proverbs 22:6, what is the result of training up a child in the way he should go?
options: He will not depart from it when he is old
He will always obey his parents
verseText: Train up a child in the way he should go; even when he is old he will not depart from it.

text: What is compared to 'apples of gold in a setting of silver' in Proverbs 25:11?
verseText: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in a setting of silver.
